snippet: Fighting between the Syrian army and rebels near the capital’s center extended into a third day, overshadowing diplomatic efforts to end the conflict.
abstract: Tensions escalate in Damascus as clashes between the Syrian Army and rebels near the city center extend into a third day, with government forces throwing a security cordon around some embattled neighborhoods, firing from helicopters and reinforcing the number of tanks on the streets; urban combat overshadows international diplomacy aimed at halting the conflict.

byline.original: By NEIL MacFARQUHAR and DALAL MAWAD
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad from Istanbul, J. David Goodman and Rick Gladstone from New York, Isabel Kershner from Jerusalem, Eric Schmitt from Washington, and an employee of The New York Times from Damascus, Syria.

lead_paragraph: Fighting between the Syrian army and rebels near the capital’s center extended into a third day, overshadowing diplomatic efforts to end the conflict.

headline.seo: Syria Hardens Response to Clashes in Damascus
headline.main: Syria Hardens Its Response to Rebels in Damascus Clashes
headline.print_headline: Syrian Army Hardens Its Response to Rebel Clashes in Damascus
